messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: In the last 200 years, technology and health became better. This meant that fewer children died when they were young. This caused fast population growth. These large families had even more children who grew up and had their own families. However, things changed in the 1960s. Contraception, which are methods to prevent pregnancy, became more common. Now, the global average number of babies for each woman has gone down from six to only two.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. The text violates the sentence length rule. The sentence 'These large families had even more children who grew up and had their own families' (16 words) and 'Now, the global average number of babies for each woman has gone down from six to only two' (19 words) are too long. Sentences must not exceed approximately 15 words. The grammatical structure 'Contraception, which are methods...' is awkward for a B1 level; 'Contraception is the use of methods...' is a simpler, clearer construction.

Text saved: In the last 200 years, technology and health became better. This meant that fewer children died when they were young. This caused fast population growth. These large families had even more children. These children grew up and had their own families. However, things changed in the 1960s. Contraception is the use of methods to prevent pregnancy. It became more common. Now, the global average number of babies for each woman has gone down. It has dropped from six to only two.
